payload.name: tail-latency-is-usually-queueing-not-kernel-speed
payload.title: Tail latency is usually queueing, not kernel speed
payload.formal: p99 latency explodes when utilization (\rho \to 1). In M/M/1, (W = \frac{1}{\mu-\lambda}) (diverges as (\lambda \uparrow \mu)).
payload.apm2_mapping: the daemon’s HEF pulse plane already includes queue depth limits and drop policy—this is the correct instinct: **bound queues, drop low-priority first**. Extend this to tool execution, gate evaluation, and evidence publication: every subsystem needs backpressure and bounded in-flight work, or you will get cascading failure.
